author: A_Brickset_user
title: Follow that beacon
review: I have had this set about 12-13 years.  I recommend it to anyone interested in space.  It is the only set with the M logo on a window in M-tron.  Of the 3 small models I think this one is easily the best. One gripe, where are the magnets.

author: Aaronlego
title: Nice little buggy thing
review: This set is pretty neat beacuse of the giant window.I like the way that the window opens.Also, how the control panel comes down is pretty nice.This set is awesome because the wheels make it so this little thing can go over all terrain at high speeds.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: My first Lego set ever!
review: I believe it was my fifth birthday, but I got this nifty little M:Tron vehicle as  my first ever lego set, and from then on life consisted of little else than these wonderful plastic bricks.  That note aside, it's a pretty typical small set, with a figure and a vehicle, but also enough special parts to make it useful for building alternate models.  It's got several neon green parts, including a windshield, which really make it nifty for kids.  I suppose it's nothing spectacular but then again I am biased because of my nostalgic attachment to this one :P

author: zinkk757
title: 5/5 classic rover
review: This is my favorite m-tron set next to the mega core, and i can't express how cool this set is.  I only own one that i bought with a copy of each other set in the m-tron series.  I love how there are so many transparent neon green peices.  The two printed parts in the set are outstanding as well.  This is the onlt space set with a logo printed on that type of windshield.  The black 45 degree 2 x 2 with the yello grills is also cool.  Overall, this set is an absolute must for any space colector.

author: MPH
title: Somewhat out of proportion
review:
The M:Tron theme has a nice variety in both vehicles and aircrafts (but alas, no real base) and this is the smallest of the former category. Just like in most other M:Tron sets, the colors of this set are great. Red, black and trans-neon-green make for a very pleasing, contrasty combination.

The buggy itself is cool, but not superb: I have a feel it is a bit out of proportion. To me it seems too high, compared to its width and depth. Nevertheless, you won't be dissapointed in adding this to your M:Tron collection.

author: Loganwan
title: Rocket Boosters and big wheels
review:
What more do you need in a rover, other than a magnet to go with the rest of the M-Tron line.   The wheels on this vehicle are probably the best feature, deviating from the generic Lego wheels, and coming up with something fun and space aged.

The wind screen was a nice touch that I thought some of the other small vehicles should have included as well.

author: AETerry
title: Beacon Tracer Review
review:
There were only a couple of the M-Tron sets that I picked up, particularly among the smaller sets before deciding that ultimately, M-Tron wasn't for me. The sets are great, red with neon yellow elements.

 

It's not a bad little set, minimal cover or protection for the driver, new print design for the computer console element. Oversized tires that look the part of a Space Bound planetary vehicles. There's not much to complain about with this set, M-Tron just wasn't the theme that really interested me.

author: kvasir
title: I can live without this set
review:
This is also known as the M:Tron Inspection Buggy (I used to get most my LEGO ® in Hong Kong, which came with the European version of the catalogue).
I remember I got this from a LEGO ® show in Hong Kong, most likely in 1990. My mother let me pick a set within a certain price range as a souvenir of the visit. I can't remember why I picked this since I was never into space. Maybe I got a little excited over those transparent neon green parts.

Box/Instructions

The box is long gone now, but I have kept the instruction and catalogue (as a wish list) all these years.


Parts

The main attraction here is obviously the trans green neon parts. I was always careful with the very fragile looking neon antenna when looking for parts in my LEGO ® pails.


Other than that, the parts are not too versatile, you can't do much with them other than another space vehicle.


Minifigures

The only thing I absolutely love about this set is the colour contrast on the M:Tron inspector. He provides me the only black gloves I have.


The build

I can't remember what I felt when I first built it, but putting it together for the first time after some 20 years certainly brings such nostalgia! Looking for the parts amongst a decade worth of LEGO ® took much longer than the build, obviously.


The completed model

[img]http://farm6.static.flickr.com/5256/5511025851_641c9d4620.jpg[/img]

Full set of #6833 -- M:Tron Inspection Buggy / Beacon Tracer -- with instruction leaflet.


Summary

Like I said, I never got into whole space theme. M:Tron didn't change my mind either. This is the only piece I have of the M:Tron series and only one of two space theme LEGO ® I have. I can live without it to be honest.


I may consider exchange offers for some other city / castle / pirate set of similar size, age, and condition.

author: James83
title: M-Tron Go-Anywhere Buggy
review:
This sturdy little buggy is basic but good looking. 

The Vehicle

This is a basic build with few parts but although at first glance it doesn't look much there are some neat touches. The jacked-up rear wheels really suit the overall design. The cone headlights look suitably futuristic and the balloon tyres are quite rare outside of Space sets. The canopy is a unique panel with a printed M-Tron logo which sadly didn't feature on any other set. It is hinged at the front and the cones attached the rear end serve as a handle to open it. The control panel is cleverly mounted on a hinge brick, which would have been nice to see on other designs. Behind the driver is a neon green printed vent sloped brick, presumably an engine vent and the rear features two green dishes and an antenna, which is a bit wobbly. However, the designers omitted any means to stow the hand-held radio.

The Minifigure

A standard M-Tron figure with airtanks and a hand-held radio.

Personal Developments

Like most of my M-Tron sets, this had a long life in my collection. I added another clip brick on the back to carry the radio but there is little growth in the design to make serious changes. Overall its a neat vehicle but probably not really versatile enough unless you break it down and build something new.
